<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>library(<span class="pl-smi">lubridate</span>); ymd(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>20140108<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
mdy(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>08/04/2013<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
dmy(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>03-04-2013<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)</pre></div>

<p><a href="http://www.r-statistics.com/2012/03/do-more-with-dates-and-times-in-r-with-lubridate-1-1-0/">http://www.r-statistics.com/2012/03/do-more-with-dates-and-times-in-r-with-lubridate-1-1-0/</a></p>

<hr>

<h2><a id="user-content-dealing-with-times" class="anchor" href="#dealing-with-times" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Dealing with times</h2>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>ymd_hms(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>2011-08-03 10:15:03<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
ymd_hms(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>2011-08-03 10:15:03<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-v">tz</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Pacific/Auckland<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
?<span class="pl-smi">Sys.timezone</span></pre></div>

<p><a href="http://www.r-statistics.com/2012/03/do-more-with-dates-and-times-in-r-with-lubridate-1-1-0/">http://www.r-statistics.com/2012/03/do-more-with-dates-and-times-in-r-with-lubridate-1-1-0/</a></p>

<hr>

<h2><a id="user-content-some-functions-have-slightly-different-syntax" class="anchor" href="#some-functions-have-slightly-different-syntax" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Some functions have slightly different syntax</h2>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-v">x</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> dmy(c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>1jan2013<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>2jan2013<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>31mar2013<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>30jul2013<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>))
wday(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>])
wday(<span class="pl-smi">x</span>[<span class="pl-c1">1</span>],<span class="pl-v">label</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>)</pre></div>

<hr>

<h2><a id="user-content-notes-and-further-resources" class="anchor" href="#notes-and-further-resources" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M4 9h1v1H4c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5S2.55 3 4 3h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-.91 2.72-2 3.25V8.59c.58-.45 1-1.27 1-2.09C10 5.22 8.98 4 8 4H4c-.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5S3 9 4 9zm9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5S13.98 12 13 12H9c-.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-.83.42-1.64 1-2.09V6.25c-1.09.53-2 1.84-2 3.25C6 11.31 7.55 13 9 13h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5S14.5 6 13 6z"></path></svg></a>Notes and further resources</h2>

<ul>
<li>More information in this nice lubridate tutorial <a href="http://www.r-statistics.com/2012/03/do-more-with-dates-and-times-in-r-with-lubridate-1-1-0/">http://www.r-statistics.com/2012/03/do-more-with-dates-and-times-in-r-with-lubridate-1-1-0/</a></li>
<li>The lubridate vignette is the same content <a href="http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/lubridate/vignettes/lubridate.html">http://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/lubridate/vignettes/lubridate.html</a></li>
<li>Ultimately you want your dates and times as class "Date" or the classes "POSIXct", "POSIXlt". For more information type <code>?POSIXlt</code></li>
</ul>
</article>
